pullRequest.body:
Example:
```lean
inductive Tree (Î± : Type _) where
  | leaf (x : Î±)
  | node (left right : Tree Î±)
  deriving Encodable, Repr

#eval Encodable.encode <| Tree.node (Tree.leaf 3) (Tree.node (Tree.leaf 7) (Tree.leaf 2))
/-
10437032233523097799499788232983267677170721881484
73517988986353410160044811898677552739268788500004
06270188013410746632624159595593095352124521885673
82941794919440887137607406767764688460275582824709
0518921337578787046
-/
#eval
  let n := 104370322335230977994997882329832676771â€¦
  (Encodable.decode n : Option (Tree Nat))
/-
some (Tree.node (Tree.leaf 3) (Tree.node (Tree.leaf 7) (Tree.leaf 2)))
-/
```

This supports all non-reflexive non-nested inductive types with no indices. It can handle mutual inductive types.

Indexed inductive types are left for future work.


---

Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> Mathlib.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->

* The `relative` value is the weighted *sum* of the differences with weight given by the *inverse* of the current value of the statistic.
* The `absolute` value is the `relative` value divided by the total sum of the inverses of the current values (i.e. the weighted *average* of the differences).
</details>

:v: kmill can now approve this pull request. To approve and merge a pull request, simply reply with `bors r+`. More detailed instructions are available [here](https://bors.tech/documentation/getting-started/#reviewing-pull-requests).

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/13210998880/job/36884225231)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/13210998880/job/36884225135)

This is nice. Just one comment.

bors d+

I like the high-level idea and think it's useful to have such a deriving handler.

I did not look at all the content in great detail, but think this would be useful regardless of the implementation.

Thanks!

maintainer merge

I like the high-level idea and think it's useful to have such a deriving handler.

I did not look at all the content in great detail, but think this would be useful regardless of the implementation.

Thanks!

maintainer merge

This is nice. Just one comment.

bors d+
I don't understand why you chose to mark everything as `private` but not this nor `mkFromSFuns `. Is this on purpose?
It's just an oversight. Fixed it.

Given that `Encodable` contains data, and that the data you generate mention `S`, we might conceivably want to write lemmas about `S` and `S.encode`. Maybe give a proper name and make it non-private? (or not give it a proper name and make it `protected`)

Let's consider the actual encoding to be an implementation detail, since it's subject to change.

I've added a sentence to the module doc about it being an implementation detail.

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat: `Encodable` deriving handler
